It's a great place to have a birthday party because it's easy for folks to park and it's not hard to get a reservation. i love the fried calamari, champinones al ajillo (mushrooms in a delicious garlic sauce you can sop up with your bread), paella (well worth the wait!), and the sangria is yummy. Don't want to eat a full meal? Order tapas and sangria and sit at the "bar" and listen to the old-timers chatting in Castilian Spanish.
author: Cristina M.

description:
Came here for brunch yesterday after church and the place was "aight" as far as the buffet lunch.

Bottomless mimosas are included in your brunch, but I still think for the food offered, the price at $25/person was a little too steep.

The food they had at the buffet:

seafood paella - pretty good
roast beef w/ some sort ofc creamy gravy
poached salmon
bbq chicken wings
salami
some sort of bruschetta - pretty good
meat empananadas
assortment of salads, macaroni salad, fruit salad
fresh fruits
cheeses, olives

dessert : 

flan
carrot cake
rice pudding
fruit

over all it was just okay, their regular menu wasn't available til 3pm so next time I'd like to check it out.
author: Jade B.

description: Its so cute sherri called me today to wish me a happy anniversary i thought that was so nice of her. 1 year ago we got married here and i will be there sunday for brunch i have to the food is so great and i can not forget about the staff im so excited. thank you all for making my day we love you....
author: angelina h.

description: My paella was good, the presenatation was beautiful.  My friends grill shrimp was AMAZING!!  Our dessert was the best creme brulee either of us have ever had in our lives. The service was performed by a nice young man from Spain and he was great.
author: Lisa B.

description:
So glad my friend brought me here, the food was delicious, the service was warm and the sangria was always flowing.

Let's go down the list of yummies I had last night:

1 pitcher of Sangria, yes, only order this by the pitcher because you will kick yourself after your glass is empty.  

Cold tapas...
potatoes with aioli - your traditional potatoe salad, very good, well flavored, looks like that gave us the full 10 pound bag of potato, excellent!

Dry Chorizo - a very generous plate of dry chorizo and olives, the saltyness of the olives and the full flavor sliced sausage was a great combo

marinated anchovies - OMG, perfectly tangy and oh so good, i recommend using it as a spread on your bread

Now for the hot stuff:
calamari - just order it, it's a staple at every table.  perfectly seasoned and fried served with a huge plate of mayo.  

mussels and clams - it's ok, i'm not a huge tomato sauce person, but definitely fresh seafood

crab cakes - seriously, tapas at El Patio is not tapas anywhere else, the cakes were very crabby and HUGE.  you can't go wrong with ordering this, comes with a fresh salad to help keep the grease down.

This would be a great place for large parties because the portions are sooooo big and more than enough to share with a big group.  The flavors are perfectly paired on every dish and the service was just immpecable.  let's just say my glass was NEVER empty.  

Can't wait to bring my family back to try this place!
author: Ames K.

description:
Highly recommended by this hot biology professor in his 50s--think, a more filled-out, buff, Mexican George Clooney---.... Patio Espanol was the destination for the close family and friends of my lovely friend who just earned her bachelor of science in Cell and Molecular Biology at SFSU.  

You wouldn't think much of this place at first, since it sits next to Pacific Super on Brotherhood Way, adjacent to the BART tracks, in a not-so-accessible part of San Francisco, but it definitely is a gem of a find.  This restaurant is also housed in the Union Espanola de California--the Spanish Cultural Center.  Patio Espanola literally looks like a beautiful patio, with gorgeous ironwork decor, light fixtures, resin wooden artwork, fountains, and very high ceilings.  It's a great space to even hold private parties (I believe they cater to those requests too).  

They offer a tremendous and fantastic selection of Spanish tapas (hot and cold), including: mussels/clams in wine/garlic tomato cream sauce, SERRANO HAM, manchego cheese with pineapple, calamari, chorizos, delicious albondigas (meatballs), and plenty more!
I need to come back here to try the crabcakes, fried monkfish, tripe, and whatever else we didn't order last night.

On top of tapas, they serve PAELLA (both the Valenciana and Marinera variety), and other entrees.  I had the steak.

May I tell you more about the steak?  Okay---it was perfectly medium rare and served with a glorious... GLORIOUS.... mushroom and brandy wine reduction... it.was.EXCELLENT..... that I kept eating it PAST my satiation point, until a pregnant woman stopped me because she knew  how much I had already complained to her that I was getting HECKA FULL (from the tapas, the bread, and SANGRIA from before).

Their fabulous sangria is STRONG and marinated with a perfect mixture of flavors that really enhanced the flavors of everything I ate.  I started getting so relaxed after half a glass or so.  It has apples and oranges, and I believe they also infused the sangria with cardamom--which was a GREAT touch and complimented my steak well.  The cardamom element of the sangria would've helped it pair well with chicken too (i know, i know... red with red, white with white, but i tried it with my friend's chicken dish and it was nice).

I will definitely come back here for the great food, great service, and the hope to run into that hot biology professor again.

( | )
author: Grace M.

description: Mother's Day 2011.. I have gone here before about 4 yrs. ago for mother's day with my in-laws. This year I took my aunts, siblings and my own mom. Last time we had the buffet in thier courtyard setting..very beautiful, this time it was full packed and we ended up in the  Salón Picasso banquet room (largest).. It seemed more like a family wedding reception hall type of setting than the enchanting Spanish style influenced surrounding. The food was just ok, a bit steep for the price you pay and I must say the buffet in Reno is comparable. I  still love the Paella Valenciana is superb here, it's the liveliest dish I last had and still is, the rest is just ok or mediocre.. I would say the bottomless mimosa is a plus to it's price. Will I come back?.. I would have to call and make sure I book for the courtyard, otherwise..i'm not getting what I pay for.
author: Ateh M.

description: I would rate this restaurant 2 stars. Service was slow and make sure to bring your patience if you decided to dine in here or else you will get heart attack for controlling your temper.  We waited 1 hr just to get our order and we waited another 1 hr for the food to be served. Were not happy with our dine in experience here. Hope they improve their service next time.
author: Arnel N.

description:
This was probably the worst tapas experience I've ever had.  And expensive, at that!  The only star is for our waiter, who was very sweet.
But, just don't eat here.  The tapas are flavorless--tortilla was literally just egg scambled with potato in it--no spices, no onion, no garlic....terrible.  The patatas alioli had no spice, just mayo.  And don't even get me started on the gambas al ajillo--they were not al ajillo-they were in a broth and overcooked. The worst part of all is that they charge $10 per tapa, so you end up paying close to $100000 for crap.  I can't believe this place is that the Spanish Cultural Center....the staff must all go someplace else to eat.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Ehh, this place is a disappointment. I was invited here for a special occasion. The place can accommodate large groups, so that's a positive. Everything else needs improvement. 

The waiters were slow and didn't get the orders right. The didn't pour the sangria and wine, didn't bring the bread out in a timely manner, and never checked if anyone needed anything. 

The food; from appetizers to the main course i though was pretty bland. The calamari was ok but they serve it with mayo as the dipping sauce.  I had the paella which was bland and the seafood tasted like it had been sitting around and they just added it on top of the rice when it was done. Those that ordered steak couldn't chew it since it was so hard. 

The place was busy overall so I'm"m not sure if they cater to locals to that area.
author: Frida C.

description:
Oh my goodness!  Eating here was like walking into my grandma's house and having her make me dinner.  This is a down home, old school, DELICIOUS and authentic Spanish restaurant.   

Let me be so bold as to claim that they serve the best paella I've had in fifteen years -- since Grandma died.  What a treat!

My biggest complaint is the location, however I also think it's a distinguishing factor from all the hipster tapas joints in the Mish. Plus, it's convenient since I live in the same crappy neighborhood.  The interior is very old fashioned but simply charming.  A+ for perfect service from hunky Spanish waiters.  Can't complain about that!

The restaurant is part of the Spanish Cultural Center which was dedicated personally by King Juan Carlos of Spain in 1987.  Imagine that, real royalty in the OMI!

The bar, a cute little bodeguita, was filled with old timers, shooting the shit over wine, in Castillian Spanish -- more throwbacks to my grandparents.  "Miguel," the volunteer on duty gave us a quick tour of the building and promised that next time we visit, we'll have a drink together.  He thought perhaps he knew my grandparents in the 70's.

I left with a tear in my eye, a bag full of leftovers, and a smile on my face.
author: Amy A.

description: Delicioso! Excellent food, well prepared and presented. Pleasant atmosphere. I will return again for sure.
author: Laurie Anne B.

description:
My friend and her family celebrate birthdays, anniversaries and other special occasions at El Patio Espanol.  The food is set out like a buffet all you can eat. Everytime I come here, I'm beyond full, the feeling you get when you want to unbotton your pants and change into sweats. The paella is good, there's this creamy mushroom dish with a tender beef that melts in your mouth. cheeses, olives, fruit salad. The desserts are okay. 

Nice place overall.
author: Glu C.

description: Patio Espanol is the choice for the high school senior lunches.  Yeah it's a big venue and probably pretty cheap place for broke 18 year olds.  I've only been here once and I never came back cuz I found a ladybug in my salad (which caused a lot of screaming at the table from my tablemates).  Uh no thanks.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Though also a restaurant, I can only review their banquet function while here for a recently attended wedding and reception.  The banquet menu wasn't reflective much on the Spanish cuisine that's offered in their restaurant, and instead, featured more simple dishes, like pasta and salad.  Several rooms are available for rent, depending on the number of guests.  

On Alemany underneath the BART tracks, it isn't in the greatest area.  But there is parking.  Still, it seems to serve better as a place to reserve for large gatherings rather than to dine in on the fly.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
"The restaurant is part of the Spanish Cultural Center which was dedicated personally by King Juan Carlos of Spain in 1987. "

My family has been eating at this hidden gem of a restaurant...
for years...
we tend to eat here ...for almost every family celebration...

If you are looking for a place with charm and romantic atmosphere...
you are not going to find it here ... sorry 
We go for the food .. !!!

The Gambas al Ajio.... 
Chorizo  and Albondigas are the Standard Tapas
that my family order as a Constant Rule .....
as well as the Pitcher of SANGRIA!!!
author: Aldo V.

description:
Simple  some of the worst food I have ever eaten in my life.
 I picked this place going by my past experinces 10 years ago.
 Shame on me and please forgive me my 5 friends and sister for the
 horrible food.   We all went for Sunday brunch buffet wine and mimosas .  I guess if your a big drinker and can get drunk enough
you won't mind the nasty food. All for 22.00 per person.
The food all tasted old, dry , fishy  like  leftover wedding banquet
food. The hot food was cool to cold nothing had any taste of spices
(bland and tastless.)   The only good thing was the service and a few of the desserts.  There are so many wonderful other places to go for
sunday brunch in the mission and all of the city for 22.00 dollars a
person . Why would anyone waste there time on this place...

UPDATE ( This place has been given the bill h. award as  ( DRUM ROLL PLEASE  DUM DA DA DUM )   THE WORST DINING EXPERIENCE OF 2007 !!!!!!!!!
author: Bill H.

description: I visited Patio Español (correct spelling) for a dinner with my girlfriend. I made a reservation and we got seated right away. I ordered an Estrella Galicia, almejas y mejillones and bacalao a la vizcaína. The waiter was really nice. The atmosphere was nice, reminding me of the time I spent in Andalucía a few years ago. I am not really sure this place cooks true Spanish or even Basque food. The almejas y mejillones were drowned in a red sauce with too much garlic. I doubt the food is like that in Spain or the Basque area (somebody correct me if I'm wrong). Also, the mussels were small and practically tasteless. The bacalao a la vizcaína really let me down. The texture of the fish was not up to my standards of what I call good cooking. Also, the sauce that came with it was not amazing. I wonder if Bizcaia truly cooks the bacalao like that. At the end of the night I told the waiter that I didn't like the bacalao. She listened to me, took the plates away and didn't give me a hint she either understood, she cared or she was going to tell the manager that the food was mediocre. After this visit, I can only give two stars to Patio Español. The food is relatively expensive. I don't know how this place can have 4 stars. It might be nice to replace the name of the business with an ñ since ñ is not a fancy n but a true different letter just like l and ll.
author: X. Y.

description:
I like this place. It's got a good vibe to it - as it's the cultural center for San Francisco's more-substantial-than-you-think Spanish community, it's been decorated with care and attention to detail (and it's pretty cool that Juan Carlos inaugurated it). The dining room itself is rather breathtaking. Likewise because it's a meeting place for the Spanish community, it's affordable since they need to cater to people with diverse incomes. Also, because it's in an out of the way neighborhood (though not all that seedy - the area around has low crime) it's refreshingly free of any of the poisons that can annoy the average, cranky native San Franciscan - out-of-towners, yuppies, or hipsters. Simply, it's old school. 

The bar is handsome and a wide array of wines are served, all of them good. The service has usually been pretty good. Now, to the most important part..

The food is not outstanding, but very good - a B/B+. What gets it a little extra are two things:

1) They've usually got a regionally diverse group of tapas. I'd imagine this is because it's a cultural center - the Catalans, Galicians, Aragonese, Andalucians, etc all have a representative dish. 

2) They have several very good entrees (also regionally representative). Too many Spanish restaurants pretty much serve tapas (which are awesome, but are really just bar snacks in Spain) and paella. You'd think the Spanish just ate paella every day. Not this place! The medallions of lamb (cordero manchego) is particularly note worthy.

It's not the best Spanish food you'll ever eat, but it's probably got one of the best menus of any place in San Francisco in terms of representing the breathtaking diversity of Spanish food. That it does this while being affordable, and whole-heartedly embracing the culture of traditional Spain is pretty sweet.
author: Flynn H.

description:
Like everyone has mentioned before, the paella is a great dish. We ordered the paella valenciana for two. The portion for two was huge - more than enough for two people. And the amount of seafood... wow! If you do decide order the paella, order it as soon as possible since it may take a while. 

As for the restaurant itself, the atmosphere is friendly but a little dated. There were two large parties going on - one was a wedding with extremely loud music. The patio area is a nice lit place to enjoy a quiet dinner for two, or more since they can easily handle large groups.

I am looking forward to my next trip to El Patio Espanol. The other entrees looked good as well... and the desserts too! :)
author: R H.

description:
I've enjoyed El Patio Espanol for years. My Dad is from Spain, so he likes to eat here when he comes to visit.

From dinner for two to my graduation dinner for 20 a few years back, El Patio never disappoints with tasty quality food and attentive service.
author: Harley B.

description:
The first couple of times I drove by this place, my friend told me it was a funeral home, so I was pleasantly surprised to find such an authentic Spanish restaurant housed inside this nondescript building.

Their bread is very fresh and the sangria is good, although a little too fruity for my taste. As for the food...

Sopa de Ajo Aragonesa - Their very garlic-y soup really lived up to its namesake so don't expect to be making out with anyone afterwards, but YUM!

Setas Silvestres al Ajillo - Mushrooms in some type of wine/garlic sauce. The sauce was out of this world. Try dipping your bread in it once you've cleaned the plate of mushrooms.

Calamares Fritos - The calamari didn't really stand out, but it was good nontheless.

Daily Special! Catfish croquettas - OMG soooo good. Orgasmically so quite frankly. The catfish was very fresh and the croquetta came out nice and light. Not overfried like other places tend to do.

Paella Valenciana - The portions were huge so bring along an empty stomach; they also give you a LOT of seafood. [Note: You have to order at least 2 portions of the same paella so it comes to roughly 44USD minimum, but between 6 of us, there was just the right amount of food]

Solomillo a la Andaluza - You can't really go wrong with Filet Mignon, but it was a tad more medium than rare for my personal taste.

Daily Special! Leg of Lamb - They have specific family dinner options for every night of the week. We happened to drop by on a Thursday and got to try their lamb. Fabulous and tender. The meat fell right off the bones!

The service was great, very friendly and they honestly wanted to make you enjoy your food. They also catered to some of our more picky eaters by tweaking the dishes! I'm definitely coming back here soon!
author: Michele L.

description: I came here for a private party and dinner was okay but the service was bad!  When you have to ask for horseradish three times from your waiter and never getting it, I'd say the service was bad!  He kept saying that he was gonna get it.  We got tired of asking and expecting it so we ended up bringing our meat home!  I'm sure in the actual restaurant, they get what they ask for but that's unfortunate because people who have parties there will bring in more future business by referral of their experiences there.  This is one place I will not recommend for parties to anyone!
author: A D.

description:
I had my 25th birthday party here a couple years ago, and was so grateful, because I decided on a "big" (by my standards) party kind of at the last minute and was worried I wouldn't be able to find a place that could fit my large family, provide a dance floor, and also take care of the menu.

Since I had never planned a big event this way, I thought it would be harder, especially with the time constraint.  But Sherri, the events manager, presented me with all my options, and I was able to just pick and choose what I wanted, as long as it fit within the safety regulations of their facility.  

We rented the Salon El Greco, the second largest room, and our buffet consisted of a large veggie tray, mixed green salad, potato salad, pasta primavera, rolls and butter, Pollo al Jerez, and Grilled Mahi Mahi - all yummy!  

For a last minute party like that, it went really well.  And as a bonus there's ample parking.  We were a small party compared to the other one in the big banquet room, but we were enjoying ourselves so much we didn't even hear BART passing above us.
author: Connie M.

description:
We just celebrated my mother in law's birthday here and I honestly could not find a single fault with the meal.

We started off with the Croquettas de Pollo and the Morcilla followed by the scallops in cream sauce, boquerones, garlic soup and lamb chops with prawns (as well as a jug of Sangria). All that came to about $80 believe it or not. We also had a dessert of Amaretto Cream pie which was heavenly (and even managed to convince me to have some more food).
author: Anthony B.

description: This was a nice, quiet little place.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  Only tried a couple tapas and the paella.  I haven't had very many paella dishes to compare, but it was hearty, nice flavor and pretty generous, though a bit pricey.
author: Michael O.

description:
I've been to this place twice. the first being with my family for their wonderful brunch and the second for school (spanish class) who taught us the inner works of the paella.

Both times I was satisfied. Their Paella is totally rocking. It tastes soooooooo good. It's pretty much a food orgasm. Their buffet was very spanish and complete. It was really good. But really, their stand out dish here is Paella, so if you want to taste authentic spanish paella, come to El Patio and you'll be coming back for more
author: Gabe R.

description:
I thought that I would be the first to review this place. But since I'm not, I will tell you all how wonderful it is!
My aunt took my self, my boyfriend and other family members here. We were a little skeptical, I admit; but it truly was amazing. 

Authentic and wonderful tapas, healthy food, as well as other types.  I could sit there for hours just eating, absorbing the wonderful Spanish/Basque style cuisine and atmosphere.

I would recommend this place as the best Sunday brunch!
author: Lisa T.

description: it's between 3 and 4, decided to round up. the food was good (tapas, and wine) BUT it was very salty. setting was beautiful but it was a little awkward because at 9pm we were the only party left. they didn't kick us out, it was just a little strange. overall the restaurant was really empty in the middle of the week. I do want to come back and try the buffet.
author: Tiff W.

description:
way out in the deep excelsior lies this giant industrial looking restaurant. I had passed it several times in the past month and on one occasion stopped and looked in grabbed a menu and vowed to return.

it was like the idea of Spanish food in the 1960's era and not in a good way. there is nothing to recommend this place and yet what an appealing idea this place is.  
founded by the union espanol there should be more love in the kitchen and more pride in the presentation...


Well, what a disappointment! just simply awful! over priced tapas and entrees, let them know! it would be great to see a place like this turn itself around from the shadow of blue haired Spanish cuisine to the rightful place Spain is enjoying in the rest of the world in celebration of its fabulous cuisine.
author: Ricote F.

description:
A absolutely fantastic find - definitely a place I would recommend to anyone that wants a different take on a Sunday brunch.

Went there with my family this morning and the food was exceptionally good...incredible tasting, and had plenty of options to choose from.  I myself had a bit of everything...seviche, mahi mahi, clams, basil pasta...grant it, I'm totally blanking out on everything that was there.  I think it was all the mimosas.  All in all, great place to eat and highly recommended!
author: Brandon E.

description:
What can I say?  I just love Spanish food.  I have had it done incorrectly before but Patio Espanol did not disappoint.

Each dish was excellently made.  The sauces were rich and flavorful and contained good portions for tapas-style dishes.  Thankfully, we went as a small group and were able to try most of the tapas dishes.  I loved the spicy chorizo dish and the crab cakes the best.  

The only drawback is the occasional rumble of the Bart train that occasionally flies behind the restaurant.
author: Jimmie L.

description: We've passed by here many times and finally thought about it while deciding where to eat last night, and were glad we did!  Very tasty food, good service and nice atmosphere made for a very nice dinner.  The medallions of lamb and the garlic soup were the standouts, but everything was somewhere between pretty good and delicious.  There were only 2 of us so we decided to skip on the paella so we could try a variety of other dishes; but it looked delicious...next time!
author: John R.

description:
Pretty dang good Sunday brunch.  Many items offered, paella of course and lots of yummy desserts.  The service is hit or miss and they can sometimes be a wait.  My family really enjoys it and it makes a great outing to enjoy good Spanish food.  They have plenty of parking and its easy to find right off the freeway.
Oh and if you're looking for an event venue this is an option, I've seen their setup for weddings, pretty nice but I've heard its on the pricey side.
author: La C.

description:
I was unaware that El Patio Espanol is in fact a restaurant. In all outward appearances it cam across as a slightly less depressing cultural center of sorts and I was gladly feel the conquistador roots in me.
I came for my grandfathers induction into the Balboa High School athletics hall of fame ceremony. It seemed appropriate.
I dunno if the restaurant prepared the meal but it wasn't that great and not vegan. Everything was very ordinary.
The ceremony and the people attending was by far the best part of the evening.
author: JAYCE B.

description: Its got Fantastic Food! lots of space! Fits lots of people inside and has great service!
author: amy b.

description:
I couldn't wait to get to a computer to write this review.  While everything is super fresh in my mind from last night's dinner.
SO, yesterday was my birthday & my boss from work had recommended the great sangria & paella at this particular restaurant.
I was really wanting this cuisine since it's one of my favorites when I go back home to NJ. 
Besides one other table seated at around 8:30pm & my party of 14, the restaurant was empty. 1 waiter and some other workers floating around the area. My waiter, gathering from what I read on the receipt, I could call his name out, but I won't do it here. But what horrible service man!
It was my birthday and he was rushing us to order, pretty rude about many things, and basically lied about the portions of paella to make upsells on the check. HIs attitude was not very friendly, customer service lacked in all areas, though the food did come out in a timely manner.
Paella & Sangria were still very tasty. Fish in the paella was SUPER dry.
Not sure if I will return.
author: DayDay D.

description: We came here for the Sunday brunch-- party of 16. The paella wasn't that great. It was a bit on the salty side and it wasn't very flavorful. The artichoke salad was nice.. all the vegetables were drenched in olive oil. The olives were so salty. Salmon was nice and tender. Cheesecake and the flan had some weird smell to it. The octopus salad was a bit on the rotten side.. I liked the smoked salmon on the bread and the garbanzo bean soup. Everybody had to go 'number 2' when we came home...except for me that is. Great service but a bit overpriced at $25pp.
author: Colleen W.

description: If you are a person that look for a place to go with your partner to have a good diner forget this place. Number one you have to wait a hr to order food, then another to get the food, after one more hr to get the bill. I really dislike it.  I dont recommend this place to anybody.!!!
author: Carlos C.

description: AVOID!  The food was good but the service was TERRIBLE. The waiter with a bald head and strong European accent was extremely rude to us. I was a returning customer with a party of 16 people and the waiter was totally unready, inexperienced and unwilling to serve a larger group. The attitude was totally unfriendly, kind of similar to the unfriendly attitude you sometimes encounter in Europe.  I was there to spend money and I didn't need that kind of attitude.  The time we spent waiting for our food was extremely long too.  We as a group managed to have a good time despite the bad service.  Frankly, they just lost another customer...actually 16 customers!
author: Ron L.

description: Best tapas I've had outside Catalunya! The crab cakes and shrimp were magnificent. Definitely worth a trip out to the outer rim (beyond Castro)! Portion sizes are generous, as tapas are meant to be appetizers and not full meals.
author: Hasan D.

description: We just had our wedding here and had a great experience. Sherri is an awesome coordinator and makes sure everything goes smoothly. The food was delicious and Sangria was my favorite. They were very accommodating to any needs we had. We had a problem with our flowers that decided to show up at 1:30am the night before and they came and opened the place for us in the middle of the night. Highly recommended.
author: antonio o.

description: This restaurant is within walking distance from my house so I thought I should give it a try after reading several favorable reviews.  The first two tapas we ordered - Setas Silvestres (Wild mushrooms) and the Almejas y Mejillones (Clams and Mussels) were superb - plenty of sumptuous, garlicky, sauce to dip your delightful warm and crusty bread into.   Then the patatas alioli and garlic soup arrived causing the meal to plummet into utter doldrums.  The alioli didn't even have a whisper of garlic and the soup had more oil than piquant flavor.  If we had stuck with the first two dishes it would have been a 4.5 star experience.  Alas, the 1 star dishes that followed brought the whole experience down.
author: L B.

description:
best brunch ever.  a mere 20 bucks delivers all you can drink wine, mimosas, coffee, oj, soda and a fantastic buffet including paella, lamb, salmon, pasta, fruits, cheeses, mussels, lox, shrimp, salad, garbanzo soup, flan, cheesecake, chocolate mousse cake and still more stuff i can't even remember. 5 of us ate here today until we were blinded by the numbness in our bloated bellies. ewwww/awwww.

and we didn't have to circle the block 2700 times for a parking spot.
author: Joanna R.

description:
Odd.  That's the word I'll use to sum up my experience for service, dining and location.  We stopped by impromptu,  because we were cold and hungry and in the neighborhood.

The restaurant is located on Alemany Boulevard, next to an Asian supermarket, which is where we came from when we decided to take a chance and have a bite.  After reading a few Yelp! reviews, I felt it was worth the effort.

The price point is high for the quality of food, but I suppose they make up for lack of quality in quantity.  

We ordered the following items:

Spanish Soup- The soup tasted diluted and the flavors weren't integrated.  I could taste two things-- water and probably paprika, because it was a little spicy.

Fried Calamari - The calamari was fresh, but it needed a little salt.  Your standard fried calamari. 

Sauteed Murcilla - The sausage was sliced and served with vegetables and potatoes.  I don't eat blood sausage, so I can't comment.

Pan Tomate with Jamon - This bread dish is typically served with fresh tomato and garlic.  Often times, if not always, the bread is toasted.  The bread came fresh with some sort of tomato paste. 

The service was slow and our server was a little cheesy.  He referred to water as H2O and checked in on us at odd moments, then completely disappeared when we really wanted to get the bill paid and just get the hell out of there.  He also couldn't recommend a wine to the table next to us, because he told them he "didn't drink wine."  

If you're going to work a dinner service (when wine is usually involved) at least learn enough about wine to know what to recommend to pair with paella.  It's not like the restaurant has a large list...

Despite the food and the service, people seemed to be coming in.  From where, I have no idea, and I couldn't tell you why either.  I suppose it's convenient for anyone that lives in the neighborhood and decent enough to eat.  

I just won't be back myself.
author: Anna V.

description: Great paella, I have had it on a couple of occasions, it reminds me of actually being on the beaches of valencia and torrevieja and having a fresh seafood platter. The brunches are typical spanish tapas, but the selection is overall good. The service is good and you can typically get a good seat if you go there as not too many people know about it. Overall a great place to bring someone who wants to taste a good paella!...and some jamon serrano!
author: Sebastian C.

description:
Wow, Patio Espanol, is one of the best restaurant I've ate in. We had our Daughters 15th b-day their. and her Graduation party. It was the Bomb. Ms. Sherri Nash, The Events Manager is the best I've seen, every detail was taken care of. Thats why we keep coming back to have our familys party !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The Food is always Very good, along with the service !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very Happy place to be with Family and Friends !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Looking foward to have our next event their. Can't wait.

Gary P.
author: Gary P.

description:
We came here with another couple who recommends this place based on their experience.  The restaurant looks nice enough from the outside.  Although, we didn't have reservations, we were seated right away.  As you enter, there is a bar area to the right.  Once inside in hall, you'll notice how airy and spacious this place is.  With the faux terra cotta tile roof and white walls, you'll feel as if you've been transported to another place.  This establishment serves dinners, buffets, and banquets have a separate room for hosting special events.

We hankered down with a bottle of red wine and starters; balsamic sauted portabellas and fried calamari with lemon and alioli.  The portabellas were absolutely flavorsome.  Given our two orders of paella were going to take 25 minutes to cook, we waited 15 minutes after our starters were finished and have not gotten our orders of soup and salads.  We inquired our waitress about it where she admits the items were forgotten.  Instead, she said our dinner was almost ready thus she'll comp. our desserts.  Since, one of the orders is for rare prime rib, she couldn't hold up the orders to bring us the soup and salads.  Well, we could have eaten the items on the side with dinner.  While we were chatting away and waiting for our dinner, I noticed the waiter at the next table being very attentive to a large party all the while wondering what happened to our waitress.  When the prime rib arrived, the meat recipient inquired where the bone was as he wanted it for his dog.  The waitress said she'll give it to us before we leave.  My paella was okay; a bit wet and mushy for me.  It was laden with shrimp, mussels, clams, chicken, and chorizo.  We were given a choice of desserts for which we chose flan, cheese cake, and chocolate cake.  Our leftover orders were wrapped to go and packed in one bag by the waitress.  We inquired for another bag since the leftovers were for two different households.  The waitress told us whose item was on top in the bag.  Well, she got that wrong after we took a peek at the boxes in the bag.  When we got home we realized that the waitress has forgotten to give us our prime rib bone.  I think we just got a bad waitress that evening.

There is plenty of enclosed parking at this restaurant's lot.
author: Nanette L.

description: i have been coming here since i was a kid for special occasion such as weddings receptions to regular dinners. This is hands down the best paella in the bay area IMHO. This is not just my saying but you will see the awards that state this. The decor makes you feel like you are dinning in a Spanish villa back in the home country. The bar is great and i love the old school way of service. Their presentation is always on point. I have never had a bad experience in the many years that i have been dinning here.
author: Alfredo N.

description: I loved the food.  The atmosphere is very romantic and our server was great!  I had the lamb which just melted in my mouth...oh so good!  The garbanzo soup was also very delicious.  It is a bit over priced but it is great for a special occasion!
author: Erica N.

description: The food here Is delicious, especially the paella! The building itself and the atmosphere is calming relaxing and unique. The wait staff have always been wonderful and fun. I think of coming back here each time I am back in SF
author: Emily H.

description: Really excellent experience. An elegant, spacious interior completely at odds with the seediness of the neighborhood, with formally-dressed waiters - although it's casual dress for patrons. Although it's open to the public, it appears to function as sort of club for the City's Spanish community. We started  with a wonderful Spanish garlic soup seasoned with paprika and swimming with hunks of melting pork fat - heavenly. Then a selection of tapas including croquettes de bacalao and a fluffy tortilla, then paella valenciana with fresh shellfish and chorizo, finishing with beautifully-made and presented desserts incluing an excellent tiramisu - all washed down with fine Spanish wine. HIGHLY recommended - I'll be going back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Philip W.

description: Sangria red and white both good but in this case red is the way to go and quite refreshing and only $5. Calamari appetizer was quite good and a healthy portion and served with aioli and lemon. Cold potato appetizer was nothing special and would pass. Gambas al Ajillo (Garlic shrimp) plate was good and included nice saffron rice. Now the main "objective" of course  was the Paella Valencia. It was loaded with tender chunks of chicken and seafood along with chorisso. Most definitely tasty although not the best paella I have had, but great for USA standards!!!. The restaurant interior is almost like a Spanish courtyard and has a nice feel and experience. The restaurant customer service was excellent although we did have to ask for our water to be "topped off" and for the check at the end (both minor details.) Restaurant staff were very pleasant, attentive and friendly. Overall a fun and delish experience!!! Only negative factor is the Bart train that runs by shaking the building about every 20 minutes.
author: Trev D.

description: Excellent Sunday brunches in pleasant surroundings. Lavish buffet with a wide variety of Spanish foods. Champagne and wine are included in the tab which is very reasonable. I always feel so Spanish when I'm there!
author: MARGARITA V.

description:
Just ordered take-out tonight for a birthday celebration. We've never ordered take out from here but dining in sometimes isn't an option with a toddler to attend to.  Since we live only about 15 minutes away, the meal was just as good as if we had dined-in (saving us on tip). 

I haven't been here for a few years but  had a craving for their meatballs and paella.  I thought we'd also try something new and ordered the monkfish tapas as well.  Unfortunately, they forgot to include the order in my take out box and I didn't realize it until I got home.  I counted the number of boxes before I left the restaurant only to discover one of the boxes contained a bunch of individual servings of butter for the bread!  I called them and informed them.  The worker told me they still had my order there and tried to find me after I left.  They didn't offer to refund me but did say they would credit me the next time.  Since I wanted an excuse to go back, I agreed on it.

The paella was wonderful as expected (comes with soup or salad).  They usually require a minimum of 2 orders of paella but the lady who took my order today let me order just 1 order (approx $22 per order but can easily feed 2 people).  The meatballs appetizer was to die for!  They gave us a about a loaf and a half of sourdough bread with our order which was perfect for sopping up the meatball sauce.  We also ordered crabcakes which were good but definitely not the best I've had.

I took off a star for the missing fish and for the slow service  (may have been due to the large event in their "ballroom" ).  Even though I called my order in advance, I still had to wait 30 minutes for my order.  

Prices aren't cheap but not too bad for a special occasion.  Our bill came to $54 after tax (includes the charge for the missing fish).
author: Mary T.

description: I totally concur about the overpriced dishes. I only ate here once. BUT... here's what I like about El Patio Espanol, it is a great place to rent for large parties. I will warn that it can be very costly depending on the rooms you want. From wedding receptions to debuts and Christenings- I've been to many parties here for so many years. Plus parking is convenient.
author: Leroid D.

description: I like go there for sunday's brunch however its not the typical one because it is more like a fulfilling lunch type, unlimited great mimosas, paella, deserts, and other spanish food
author: Karina W.

description:
I've written about eight reviews for this site....and this is the first five star rating I've given.  

The five stars are not based on ambiance (it was cool but not transformative), service (competent but not exceptional), or cleanliness (clean but not sparkling).

The great rating is based entirely on the paella.  We had the Marinera and could eat it everyday....breakfast (put some huevos in there!), lunch, and dinner.  The seafood was ample and ocean fresh.  The portion was massive and cheap.  The seasoning was expert.

I'll be going back to this place for life.
author: MIchael R.

description: My roommates and I had dinner here last night. They had both eaten here before and had raved about the paella. We ordered the paella marinera for two and it was plenty for all three of us. The salad that comes with it (or soup) was very fresh and had a tasty dressing.  Our waiter brought us some warm crusty bread which we dipped into the delicious garlic-infused olive oil which is on all the tables. We had a bottle of  Salmon Creek Chardonnay and, for $18, it was well worth it. When the waiter brought our paella to the table he professionally served it up onto three large plates. It was full of shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari, white fish, and scallops served on a bed of beautiful saffon rice. This was the best paella I have had in SF since La Roca closed. We each ordered a different dessert and each was very good. My choice was a white chocolate pyramid with cheesecake and fresh blackberry inside. The plate and presentation of all the desserts was beautiful. Each of our desserts had a large strawberry on the side that had been cut to look like a flower. The service was as good as it gets and our waiter couldn't have been more professional and efficient. He shook each of our hands before we left and extended his hope that we would come again. Great food and not a big price!
author: Charles A.

description: I've never ordered anything here except for the Seafood Paella which I think is the best I've ever had.
author: M S.

description:
Had the paella which was nice and large. My mom and I couldn't finish it.
My daughters had steak which was suprisingly exelllent. Next  time I am coming with my husband for the chops and cocktails. 
They have one item on the kids menu, but will split certain main entrees to accomodate. 
Nice large parking lot,  don't have to sit close to other customers, great for large groups,  and water glass was always filled.
author: Sharon C.

description: Our friends were here in San Francisco and suggested that we dine at El Patio Espanol.  We were somewhat concerned that it was located "on Alemany, under the BART tracks, in the Excelsior."  No need WHATSOEVER to be concerned - the restaurant was marvelous, the service was exceptional and the food could not have been better.  We ordered their Garlic Soup, the recommended Spanish wine and tapas all around.  Everything was exceptional - the soup was first rate, the wine pleasant and interesting and the various tapas were each a masterpiece.  We couldn't resist dessert, which lived up to expectations.  Altogether a wonderful experience; it will be a new regular restaurant!  Can't believe we've lived here, what 40 years, and never knew about this place!  Five stars, highly recommended.
author: Charlene R.

description: It was OK, but not great. The food was too salty and the veggies were overcooked. The atmosphere was lacking, it was very loud and echo-y and too brightly lit. Overall, it was mediocre quality that was overpriced. But on a positive note, the sangria was yummy.
author: K M.

description: I go to this place primarily for the Paella.  It's done really well and  in the authentic spanish style.   They also have a delicious Garbanzo bean soup, Gambas al Ajillo and Creme Brulee.  On Sunday they have a brunch which is very yummy -- although I find that the Paella dries up after staying on the Chaffing dish a long time.  It is best when it its prepared and eaten right away.  The decor and ambiance of the place is okay and they have lots of room for bigger celebrations. There is lots of parking for everyone.
author: Regina P.

description: not bad, not bad at all. cool bar and nice decor. the food is ok (yummy paella) but some wait staff are utterly Philistine. this is a good place for wedding receptions and banquets and funeral lunches. warning: do not venture across Alemany, you may never be seen again !!!!!!
author: Prima D.

description: We come here when we miss Madrid or Barcelona. Minus the overpowering taste and smell of Jamon Iberico,  this place comes close. The food's always good but service can be iffy at times.
author: AndyBoy V.

description: I recently went to Patio Espanol for an event in the main banquet room,  My three experiences at El Patio Espanol were great, this time however it wasn't the case.     The saying, you get what you paid for truely is experienced here, when you go cheap with your food.   The meat item served to me and my family was complete fatty, flavorous meat.  The salmon portion was have been off the kids menu becuause it was so small.  Lastly, theres no service there.   No dispresct but, many of the banquet servers lack basic english skills.  You have to be belingual, to get some service.
author: JERRY B.

description: sometimes you can't find a bartender.i have been going to the patio for years and years. i remember my first time there but thats another story. my freinds belong to the club,my other freind wanted to buy it. i have known the ins and outs of the place,the lives and secrets of the workers and members and custemers.i don't have time to write a book. the patio as i know it now...very good menu,not bad sunday brunch,bar,ok.facilities good. service personell and loving.many events available to the public.we where never throwen out of there yet and believe me when i say that most of our group should have been thrown out and not only where not thrown out but allowed back in with open arms.
author: OSEPH E.

description: One of the best places in the Bay area to go for Spanish food.  Love the food!  From appetizers to tapas to main course meals to dessert.  I love them all.  The sangria is really good as well.  Prices are very reasonable.  I usually go for dinner but I wish they were open for lunch as well.   It is not in the best area of town but parking has never been a problem.
author: Anna S.
